title: Facebook's Q3 Earnings Will Reflect Pandemic, Politics and Payments
text: Investors will get a glimpse inside the increasingly complex world of the biggest social-media platform on Thursday (Oct. 29) when Facebook posts its third-quarter results after the market close. It's a quarter that has seen Facebook benefit from increased use due to more people working and staying at home — but suffer from weaker revenues […]

title: Bank It Or Tank It - Facebook
text: Facebook is a well-known social media stock. With a clear edge over many competitors, Facebook has consistently climbed higher.

title: Here's what to expect from social media stocks ahead of earnings
text: Justin Patterson of KeyBanc Capital Markets joins "Power Lunch" to discuss social media stocks like Twitter and Snapchat as the stay-at-home boom continues. title: Regulatory scrutiny is coming for Big Tech: Mayflower's Larry Glazer
text: Larry Glazer of Mayflower Advisors and Greg Boutle of BNP Paribas join "Power Lunch" to discuss the winners and losers in the market going into the election.

title: Facebook Enters the Crowded Cloud Gaming Market
text: The social media titan is setting a low bar for success.

title: Facebook Introduces Free Cloud Gaming For Android OS
text: Facebook is rolling out new cloud-based games in beta for Android and Windows operating systems that are free to play and don't require downloads, the social media giant announced on Monday (Oct. 26). The service was tested with 200,000 people playing Facebook's cloud-streamed games weekly in select geographic locations.

title: Facebook preparing measures to minimize disinformation and unrest before Election Day
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin breaks down what the social media company is doing to prevent the spread of disinformation before the election and civil unrest after the election.

title: Facebook preps for US election chaos with tools for ‘at-risk' nations
text: Facebook could try to tamp down on election-related chaos in the US by using safeguards it built for “at-risk” countries, a new report says. The social network will have the tools ready in case violence or other civil unrest erupts in the wake of Election Day next week as CEO Mark Zuckerberg has anticipated, The.

title: Big Techs to Report Earnings Results This Week
text: Big Techs to Report Earnings Results This Week.

title: A Sneak Peek At Expected Moves For Big Tech Earnings: Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, Facebook And Google
text: Next week is one of the more important weeks of the earnings season when we hear from Facebook (NASDAQ: FB), Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN), Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL), Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOGL) and more. Below is an early look at the expected moves for each (via Options AI).

title: Facebook (FB) to Report Q3 Earnings: What's in the Cards?
text: Facebook's (FB) Q3 results are likely to reflect continued user growth. However, ad sales are expected to have suffered from advertiser exodus despite improving ad spending.

title: Facebook adds cloud gaming feature to its platform
text: Facebook Inc on Monday launched a free-to-play cloud gaming feature on its social media platform, allowing users to stream and play games like "Asphalt 9: Legends" and "WWE SuperCard" without downloading them.

title: Here's what to expect from Big Tech earnings this week
text: Big Tech is gearing up for a big week of earnings with Facebook, Twitter, Microsoft, Amazon and Google's parent company Alphabet all reporting their quarterly results this week. Adam Singolda, founder and CEO at Taboola, and Elle Wheeler, senior marketing consultant at Elle Web Solutions, join "Squawk Box" to discuss what investors can expect from the tech giants

title: Facebook wants to add cloud games to its platform, but you won't find them on Apple devices
text: Facebook is diving further into games, and announced Monday that it has launched cloud gaming on its mobile and desktop platforms.

title: Facebook's game streaming service actually makes sense
text: Rather than trying to replace consoles, Facebook just wants to make games as easy to play as possible. But—since this is Facebook—there are privacy issues.

title: Facebook brings 'instant' streaming for mobile games, shuns Apple's iPhone
text: Most game streaming focuses on top-tier console and PC games. Facebook believes mobile's where it's at.

title: Facebook, Twitter, Google CEOs to testify before Congress: How to watch Wednesday
text: Mark Zuckerberg, Jack Dorsey and Sundar Pichai will appear before a Senate committee on Wednesday at 10 a.m. ET/7 a.m. PT.

title: Facebook steps into cloud gaming — and another feud with Apple
text: Facebook will soon be the latest tech giant to enter the world of cloud gaming. Their approach is different than what Microsoft or Google has built but Facebook highlights a shared central challenge: dealing with Apple.

title: Facebook launches cloud games but says Apple won't allow it on iOS
text: Facebook announced the launch of cloud gaming on its desktop website and Android app, but said it's unable to bring the games to iOS due to Apple's "arbitrary" policies.

title: Facebook just dropped details of its secretive cloud gaming service – including 5 titles users will be able to play in-app this week
text: Facebook is getting into cloud gaming, unveiling the first five titles it will roll out in the US. From this week, Facebook users in parts of the US will have access to five free-to-play games: "Asphalt 9: Legends", "PGA TOUR: Golf Shootout", "Solitaire", "Arthur's Tale", and "Dirt Bike: Unchained."

title: Got $3,000? 4 Proven Stocks to Buy Right Now
text: Sometimes, buying bigger can really be better.
